summary: The Holy Sovereignty Protection Act is a bill introduced in the House of Representatives. It aims to protect the U.S. citizenship of any American elected as the Supreme Pontiff of the Roman Catholic Church, preventing its revocation. Additionally, it grants tax-exempt status under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to any U.S. citizen serving in that role, applying to taxable years after May 8, 2025. The bill's title is the Holy Sovereignty Protection Act.
